page.title: 16THE TITLE OF POLWARTH
page.content: POLWARTH WAS THE PLACE WHICH GAVE RISE TO THE TITLE CARRIED BY SIR PATRICK HUME OF POLWARTH WHO BECAME THE FIRST EARL OF MARCHMONT IN 1704. ALTHOUGH THE MARCHMONT TITLE DIED WITH THE THIRD EARL NINETY YEARS LATER, BEING ONLY TRANSMITTED TO HEIRS MALE, THE POLWARTH TITLE IS STILL IN EXISTANCE AS IT DECENDED TO HEIRS GENERAL. THE LAND HOWEVER WAS INHERITED BY A GREAT NEPHEW, SIR WM. PURVES HUME CAMPBELL, BECAUSE THE LAST LORD MARCHMONT HAD QUARRELLED WITH DIRECT HEIRS, WHOM HE DISINHERITED. IT WAS THIS THIRD & LAST LORD MARCHMONT WHO BUILT MARCHMONT ITSELF TO REPLACE THE OLDER REDBRAES WHICH DATED FROM THE 17 CENTURY.
